In case of any dispute arising under this Agreement, it shall be the exclusive responsibility of the Parties to resolve such dispute through good faith negotiations. If these negotiations fail to produce a resolution within a reasonable period, either Party may unilaterally elect to terminate this Agreement or seek resolution through binding arbitration at their sole discretion, without any prior notice or liability to the other Party. Additionally, either Party shall have the right, upon giving written notice to the other Party, to transfer its rights and obligations under this Agreement to a third party, provided that such third party agrees in writing to be bound by the terms of this Agreement. The surviving Party, following any termination or transfer, shall not be obligated to provide reasons for such action, unless required by law.

original: 2. Item 17, “Renewal, Termination, Transfer and Dispute Resolution,” shall be amended by the addition of the following paragraphs at the conclusion of the Item:
ollama_generated:
2. Amendment to Section 17 - "Renewal, Termination, Transfer, and Dispute Resolution": The following provisions are hereby added to conclude this section:

In the event of a dispute arising out of or in connection with this Agreement, the parties shall engage in good faith negotiations for a period of thirty (30) days. If, after such time, the dispute remains unresolved, either party may submit the matter to binding arbitration, at their sole discretion. The decision rendered by the arbitrator shall be final and binding upon both parties, except where a court of competent jurisdiction determines otherwise.

In contrast to the original clause, this amended version introduces a mandatory 30-day negotiation period before resorting to arbitration, and allows either party to initiate the arbitration process if negotiations fail. Additionally, the decision of the arbitrator is final, but subject to potential review by a court of competent jurisdiction.

original: In any arbitration involving a franchise purchased in Washington, the arbitration site shall be either in the state of Washington, or in a place mutually agreed upon at the time of the arbitration, or as determined by the arbitrator.
ollama_generated: In any arbitration relating to a franchised business acquired in Washington, the franchisee shall have the primary discretion to select the location for arbitration. If the franchisee fails to make such selection within a reasonable timeframe, the arbitration site shall default to a mutually agreeable location within or outside of the state of Washington, as determined by the parties. However, the final decision on the arbitration site remains with the arbitrator in case of disagreement between the parties regarding the chosen location.
